rationale: 'shot up' is a vivid verb describing price increase (background condition), not intensifier + risk-adjective.
statement_text: By the end of October, US retail prices for female turkeys had shot up 28 per cent year on year, according to US Department of Agriculture data.

rationale: The phrase 'shot up 28 per cent' uses the high-potency verb 'shot up' to describe the price increase (impact).
statement_text: By the end of October, US retail prices for female turkeys had shot up 28 per cent year on year, according to US Department of Agriculture data.
